Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
Controller.java - the controller class for the whole FX project. This class provides interaction with all other classes with the users inputs and record them in the Database.
Author:
Khubaib Farah

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Controller()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void createAccountButtonAction()
    This method runs when the "Create User" button is clicked This verifies the user that the info inputted is correct and displays a message of confirmation that the employee account has been created and logged in.
    void initialize()
    This method automatically runs once the window opens.
    void loginButtonAction()
    Method runs when the "Log in" button is clicked sets the current employee logging in as the current user of the program
    void productionLineButtonAction()
    This method runs once the "Add Product" button is clicked and adds the information inputted into the database
    void recordProductionButtonAction()
    This method runs once the "Record Production" button is clicked It takes in result from productionLineButtonAction and saves it as a choice in the Product tab

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This method automatically runs once the window opens. It populates the combo boxes with choices. It also connects to the database to populate the arraylist with data from the database.

    • productionLineButtonAction

      public void productionLineButtonAction()
      This method runs once the "Add Product" button is clicked and adds the information inputted into the database

    • recordProductionButtonAction

      public void recordProductionButtonAction()
      This method runs once the "Record Production" button is clicked It takes in result from productionLineButtonAction and saves it as a choice in the Product tab

    • loginButtonAction

      public void loginButtonAction()
      Method runs when the "Log in" button is clicked sets the current employee logging in as the current user of the program

    • createAccountButtonAction

      public void createAccountButtonAction()
      This method runs when the "Create User" button is clicked This verifies the user that the info inputted is correct and displays a message of confirmation that the employee account has been created and logged in.
